Add.description: Pure additive blend, brightens by accumulating light.

Alpha.description: Standard transparency blending based on source alpha.

Alpha add.description: Additive blending that respects source transparency.

Alpha saturate.description: Clamps alpha to avoid oversaturation; useful for particles.

Alpha mask.description: Acts like a stencil mask; replaces destination where alpha > 0.

Darken.description: Keeps darker portions of source and blends with destination.

Exclusion.description: Creates a difference-like effect with softer contrast than 'difference'.

Ghosting.description: Creates ghost-like transitions by mixing source alpha with inverse destination alpha.

Hard contrast.description: High-contrast blend using source color against inverted destination.

Lighten.description: Emphasizes brighter portions of the source.

Multiply.description: Darkens by multiplying source and destination colors.

Overlay.description: Overlay-like effect that boosts midtone contrast.

Overlay inverted.description: Weird inverted overlay effect with transparency artifacts.

Screen.description: Brightens by inverting, multiplying, and inverting again.

Subtract.description: Inverted add effect, useful for subtractive-like blending.
